Title: Fellowship raises climate activists
Summary: The Lake Chad Climate Justice Fellowship is raising at least 20 young climate activists from Nigeria, Chad, Niger, and Cameroon . The Fellowship is funded by the Climate Justice Resilience Fund (CJRF) and implemented by DEAN Initiative .

Title: Insecurity: Ondo police command trains 160 operatives on intelligence gathering
Summary: The Ondo State Police Command has trained 160 personnel in intelligence gathering to enhance the state’s security architecture . The training is part of a plan to strengthen the state's security forces .

Title: Health workers demand pay rise in Niger
Summary: Medical and Health Workers Union of Nigeria (MHWUN) in Niger has urged the state government to increase its members’ salaries due to the hazardous nature of their jobs . The state Chairman of the union, Comrade Usman Abubakar-Dabban, made the announcement .

Summary: FBI, DEA request 90 days to release Tinubu’s records on alleged drug investigation . The long-awaited records were expected to be released by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Drug Enforcement Administration .

Summary: Workers across the nation marked the 2025 International Workers’ Day with parades, solidarity marches, and speeches . Deep divisions emerged between labour unions and government authorities over the true state of workers’ welfare .

Title: Armoury explosions: Commander cautions Borno residents against picking strange objects
Summary: Theatre Commander, Operation Hadin Kai, Major General Abdulsalam Abubakar has warned residents of Maiduguri to desist from picking up strange particles or fragments suspected to be unexploded ordnance . The explosions, which rocked the city around 11:30 pm, threw several communities into chaos .

Title: FG stops work on Sagamu-Iperu Road over poor quality
